## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the system unmounted the device; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

When this method begins, it posts an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWorkspace/willUnmountNotification] to the `NSWorkspace` object’s notification center. When it is finished, it posts an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWorkspace/didUnmountNotification].

Prefer the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWorkspace/unmountAndEjectDevice(at:)] method because it provides more detailed error information.

# unmountAndEjectDevice(atPath:)

**Instance Method**

Unmounts and ejects the device at the specified path.

## Declaration

```swift
func unmountAndEjectDevice(atPath path: String) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **path**: The path to the device.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the system unmounted the device; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

When this method begins, it posts an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWorkspace/willUnmountNotification] to the `NSWorkspace` object’s notification center. When it is finished, it posts an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWorkspace/didUnmountNotification].

Prefer the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWorkspace/unmountAndEjectDevice(at:)] method because it provides more detailed error information.

You can safely call this method from any thread of your app.

## Unmounting a Device

- **unmountAndEjectDevice(at:)**: Attempts to eject the volume mounted at the given path.
